revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Jay Pharoah | image = Jay Pharoah by Gage Skidmore.jpg | caption = Pharoah in June 2016. | birth_name = Jared Antonio Farrow | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Chesapeake, Virginia]], U.S. | occupation = Actor, comedian, rapper | years_active = 2010–present }} '''Jared Antonio Farrow''', better known by his stage name '''Jay Pharoah''', is an American actor, stand-up comedian, [[impressionist (entertainment)|impressionist]], and rapper. He joined the cast of [[NBC]]'s ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' in 2010, for its [[Saturday Night Live (season 36)|thirty-sixth season]].<ref name=WashingtonPost>{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=Virginia native Jay Pharoah snags cast spot on "Saturday Night Live"; will he be their new Obama? Pharoah also raps|url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/reliable-source/2010/09/this_just_in_saturday_night_li.html |quote= |work=[[Washington Post]] |date=September 8, 2010 |accessdate=2010-09-27 }}</ref> In 2015, he was ranked the 55th greatest ''Saturday Night Live'' cast member by ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine.<ref name="rollingstone.com">{{Cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv/lists/saturday-night-live-all-141-cast-members-ranked-20150211/55-jay-pharoah-20150211|title=55. Jay Pharoah - 'Saturday Night Live': All 141 Cast Members Ranked|website=Rolling Stone|access-date=2016-06-12}}</ref>
==Early life==
Pharoah began doing impersonations at age six and cites [[Gilbert Gottfried]]'s character in ''[[Aladdin (1992 Disney film)|Aladdin]]'', [[Iago (Aladdin)|Iago]], as his first voice, explaining, "My father put me in a talent competition a couple of months later, and out of the whole thing I got fifth place."<ref name=FabFour>Moynihan, Rob. "''SNL''{{'}}s Fab Four", ''[[TV Guide]]'', March 7, 2011, Pages 44-45</ref>
In 2005, Pharoah graduated from [[Indian River High School (Virginia)|Indian River High School]] in Chesapeake. One of his characters, Principal Daniel Frye, is heavily influenced by IRHS's former principal,<ref>{{cite web|author=The Virginian-Pilot© June 12, 2014 |url=http://hamptonroads.com/2014/06/after-27-years-indian-river-principal-james-frye-retires# |title=After 27 years, Indian River Principal James Frye retires|publisher=HamptonRoads.com |date=2014-06-12 |accessdate=2014-11-11}}</ref> James Frye.<ref>{{cite web|author=The Virginian-Pilot© December 14, 2010 |url=http://hamptonroads.com/2010/12/jay-pharoah-pays-tribute-his-chesapeake-principal-snl |title=Jay Pharoah pays tribute to his Chesapeake principal on 'SNL'|publisher=HamptonRoads.com |date=2010-12-14 |accessdate=2012-01-15}}</ref> Pharoah went on to study business at [[Tidewater Community College]] and [[Virginia Commonwealth University]].<ref name=WashingtonPost/>
==Career== [[File:Jay Pharoah.jpg|thumb|right|Pharoah at The Stand in June 2016.]] Pharoah has been performing stand-up comedy in community theaters and at comedy clubs in Virginia since he was 15.<ref>Sources conflict on when he started standup. The [http://voices.washingtonpost.com/reliable-source/2010/09/this_just_in_saturday_night_li.html ''Washington Post''] source indicates he started at 15.</ref> He at one point toured with [[Corey Holcomb]] and [[Charlie Murphy]].<ref name=WashingtonPost/> He became known for his many celebrity impressions,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcuniversal.presscentre.com/content/detail.aspx?ReleaseID=1683&NewsAreaId=2 |title=NBC'S 'SATURDAY NIGHT LIVE' PREMIERES SEPTEMBER 25 WITH SNL ALUM AMY POEHLER & CHART-TOPPING MUSICAL GUEST KATY PERRY |publisher=Nbcuniversal.presscentre.com |date=2010-09-07 |accessdate=2012-01-15}}</ref> including [[Barack Obama]], [[Will Smith]], [[Jay-Z]], [[50 Cent]], [[Eddie Murphy]], [[Charlie Murphy]], [[Chris Rock]], [[Kanye West]], [[Stephen A. Smith]], and [[Denzel Washington]].<ref name=WashingtonPost/>
Pharoah can also be seen on an episode of MTV's Yo Momma. {{Citation needed|date=July 2018}}
Pharoah became an internet phenomenon when his impersonation of [[Barack Obama]] became widely seen on [[YouTube]]. In early 2010, Pharoah appeared in a series of segments that aired on ''[[106 & Park]]'' in promotion for the [[BET Awards|2010 BET Awards]], where his character had to deliver an important package for television personalities [[Rocsi]] and [[Terrence Jenkins|Terrence J]].<ref name=WashingtonPost/><ref name=FabFour/>
===2010–2016: ''Saturday Night Live''=== In 2010, Pharoah was hired by ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' as a featured player for the show's 36th season. Pharoah debuted on ''Saturday Night Live'' on September 25, 2010 and was regarded by Rob Moynihan of ''[[TV Guide]]'' as the "breakout player" for that season, for his impersonations of [[Barack Obama]], [[Ben Carson]], [[Kanye West]], [[Jay-Z]], [[Stephen A. Smith]], [[Will Smith]], [[Eddie Murphy]], [[Tracy Morgan]], [[Chris Rock]], [[Chris Tucker]], [[Michael Strahan]], [[Lil Wayne]], [[Kendrick Lamar]], and [[Denzel Washington]].<ref name=WashingtonPost/><ref name=FabFour/> He debuted his ''SNL'' impersonation of Barack Obama in the 38th season premiere on September 15, 2012, succeeding [[Fred Armisen]] in that role.<ref name=TVGuide>"Inbox". ''[[TV Guide]]''. October 8, 2012.</ref> ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine described him as the "Jimmy Fallon of 2 Chainz impressions."<ref name="rollingstone.com"/>
Pharoah appeared in the independent film ''[[Lola Versus]]'', released by [[Fox Searchlight Pictures]] in June 2012. In 2014, he had a small role in the buddy cop film ''[[Ride Along (film)|Ride Along]]'', starring [[Ice Cube]] and [[Kevin Hart]], and appeared in the independent film ''[[Balls Out (2014 film)|Balls Out]]'', a sport comedy starring fellow ''SNL'' cast members [[Beck Bennett]] and [[Kate McKinnon]].<ref name=HuffPost>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/07/24/kate-mckinnon-shooting-intramural-in-austin-this-summer_n_3646030.html|title=Kate McKinnon, Jay Pharoah Shooting Indie 'Intramural' In Austin This Summer|last=Luippold|first=Ross|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=2013-07-24|accessdate=2014-03-10}}</ref>
In 2016, he appeared in a [[Television advertisement|commercial]] for [[Old Navy]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.campaignlive.com/article/old-navy-enlists-snl-alums-improvise-series-online-spots/1393554|title=Old Navy enlists ''SNL'' alums to improvise series of online spots|publisher=www.campaignlive.com|access-date=2016-06-12}}</ref> alongside fellow ''SNL'' cast members [[Nasim Pedrad]] and [[Cecily Strong]]. On August 8, 2016, it was announced Pharaoh alongside fellow cast member [[Taran Killam]] would be exiting the show ahead of its 42nd season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://shadowandact.com/2016/08/08/jay-pharoah-is-saying-goodbye-to-saturday-night-live-to-pursue-other-opportunities/|title=Jay Pharoah Is Saying Goodbye to 'Saturday Night Live' to Pursue Other Opportunities|website=shadowandact.com}}</ref> Pharoah hosted the [[American Music Awards of 2016]] with model [[Gigi Hadid]]. Pharoah has been working on his first album with record producer Myles William.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pitchfork.com/news/67935-jay-pharoah-saturday-night-live-preps-new-mixtape/|title=Jay Pharoah (“Saturday Night Live”) Preps New Mixtape - Pitchfork|website=pitchfork.com}}</ref>
==Personal Life== Since 2017, he has been dating singer Sonna Rele. {{Citation needed|date=July 2018}}
== Filmography == === Film and television === * ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' (2010–2016) * ''[[Lola Versus]]'' (2012) * ''[[Ride Along (film)|Ride Along]]'' (2014) * ''[[Balls Out (2014 film)|Balls Out]]'' (2014) * ''[[Top Five]]'' (2014) * ''Can I Be Me?'' (2015)<ref>https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/jay_pharoah_can_i_be_me</ref> * ''[[Get a Job (2016 film)|Get a Job]]'' (2016) * ''[[Sing (2016 American film)|Sing]]'' (2016) - Meena's Grandfather (voice) * ''[[Match Game]]'' (2017) * ''[[White Famous]]'' (2017) * ''[[Family Guy]]'' (2017) - Kanye Canes (voice, "Don't Be a Dickens on Christmas") * ''[[Unsane (film)|Unsane]]'' (2018)
===Video games=== * ''[[Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare]]'' (2016)
